title: 23 Reboots and Revival TV Shows in the Works for 2017 (PHOTOS)
text:
‘Vampire Chronicles’ Advertisement 
With The Vampire Diaries series finale inching closer, we couldn’t be more excited for this in-the-works adaptation inspired by Anne Rice’s movie-slash-book series . ‘The Lost Boys’ ‘The Lost Boys’ Advertisement 
With The Vampire Chronicles still so up in the air, we’ll also accept the CW’s in-development Lost Boys TV reboot as our TVD replacement — maybe it will even snag the Salvatore brothers' timeslot this fall. ‘Charmed’ ‘Charmed’ Advertisement 
The unexpected details of this still-in-the-planning-stages CW reboot have us a little nervous. But, we’ll give the ladies of Charmed 2.0 some time to prove we’ll love them just as much as we love Prue, Piper, Phoebe, Paige, and even Billie. ‘Gossip Girl’ ‘Gossip Girl’ Advertisement 
Yes, the drama-loving CW series only went off the air in 2012, but the Gossip Girl creators are already talking about a revival. 
While creator Josh Schwartz admitted to E! News in July 2016, “We haven't really thought about it," there’s still a little hope. 
"I would do it, why not?" he continued. "I got Jessica Szohr and Chace Crawford [in]. I don't know what the rest are up to, but I'd be down. Why not?" 
XOXO, you know we love you, Josh. ‘Fame’ Advertisement 
Lifetime has picked up a reboot of leg warmer-loving Fame . So You Think You Can Dance ’s Nigel Lythgoe will executive produce, while Gossip Girl ’s Josh Safran will write the pilot and produce. We guess this means Josh will be too busy to join that GG revival? ‘Dynasty’ ‘Dynasty’ Advertisement 
If you’ve given up on Empire and its ghost threesomes , the CW is hoping to interest you in a totally different diverse primetime soap . ‘Twin Peaks’ ‘Twin Peaks’ Advertisement 
This 1990s cult favorite will return on Sunday, May 21, on Showtime. It already looks damn fine. ‘X-Files’ ‘X-Files’ Advertisement 
FOX is open to making more of The X-Files and is currently figuring out a game plan. “There are a lot of conversations going on,” the network’s entertainment president David Madden admitted during the Television Critics Association press tour. “Those conversations are complex, but we hope to be able to announce something very shortly.” ‘Beaches’ ‘Beaches’ Advertisement 
Lifetime will premiere its reboot of Bette Midler's 1988 favorite on Saturday, January 21, with Idina Menzel and Nia Long in the lead roles. ‘Star Trek: Discovery’ Dec 11, 2016 at 9:52am PST ‘Star Trek: Discovery’ Advertisement 
CBS will make history this May with its reboot of the long-running Star Trek franchise. 
The CBS All-Access rama will have the series’ first black female lead in The Walking Dead ’s Sonequa Martin-Green. ‘That’s So Raven’ A photo posted by Raven-Symoné (@ravensymone) on Dec 12, 2016 at 12:30pm PST ‘That’s So Raven’ Advertisement 
Original stars Raven-Symoné and her TV BFF Anneliese Louise van der Pol will appear in the upcoming Disney Channel revival. 
Orlando Brown is not so lucky . ‘Foxy Brown’ ‘Foxy Brown’ Advertisement 
The wonderful Meagan Good will star in this upcoming Hulu reboot of the 1970s blaxploitation film of the same name. Original star Pam Grier has yet to officially comment on the series, but she did retweet a bunch of stories on the streaming show — so we’ll take that as a seal of approval. ‘Love Connection’ Jan 11, 2017 at 9:28am PST ‘Love Connection’ Advertisement 
Andy Cohen is heading up an LGBT-friendly reboot of the classic game show for FOX. The Bravo king will host and executive produce the new Love Connection . ‘The Norman Lear Collection’ ‘The Norman Lear Collection’ Advertisement 
The famed comedy creator is in talks with Sony Pictures Television to create updated six-episode anthologies of his beloved series like The Jefferson , All in the Family , and Good Times . New actors would be brought in for the contemporary limited series. ‘Living Single’ ‘Living Single’ Advertisement 
Star ’s Queen Latifah has confirmed she’s working on getting her 1990s comedy back on the air. “It’s not there yet, but hopefully we can get it happening,” she said on Watch What Happens Live on January 13. ‘Heathers’ Nov 22, 2016 at 10:01am PST ‘Heathers’ 
If this TV Land reboot is worthy of Shannen Doherty it’s worthy of us. Thankfully, the network has officially picked up the Heathers reboot for a 10-episode first season with original star Shannen in a "pivotal" mystery role. It's expected to premiere this fall. ‘Arrested Development’ ‘Arrested Development’ Advertisement 
Rejoice, as Netflix is “really close” to pulling off a fifth season of the quirky comedy, executive producer Brian Grazer tells The Wrap . 
But, Arrested Development Season 5 may not be what fans are expecting, since a portion of the new episodes could be prequels involving new and younger actors, TVline.com reports. 
The plan “isn’t entirely set in stone,” although it would help with figuring out the wildly busy cast's schedule. 
If the new installments are better than Season 4, we’ll do the chicken dance — prequels or not. ‘Will & Grace’
